Interface DOMWindow

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DOMEventTarget

    public interface DOMWindow
extends DOMEventTarget
    Author:
    Giovanni Grasso (giovannigrasso@gmail.com) Oxford University, Department of Computer Science

      • getDocument

        DOMDocument getDocument()
        Returns the current document node (that can be stale though @see getDocument(boolean)
        Returns:

      • getDocument

        DOMDocument getDocument(boolean checkIfStale)
        Returns the document. If it is stale, the new current docuemnt will be returned
        Parameters:
        checkIfStale -
        Returns:

      • getScrollX

        int getScrollX()
        Accessor for the current x scroll position in this window in pixels. This attribute is "replaceable" in JavaScript

      • getScrollY

        int getScrollY()
        Accessor for the current y scroll position in this window in pixels. This attribute is "replaceable" in JavaScript

      • isJustOpened

        boolean isJustOpened()
        Returns true is the current page is opened in a new fresh window, and not just loaded in the previous window on which an action was performed. IMPORTANT: as side affect, once accessed, following invocation of this method will return false
        Returns:
        true is the current page is opened in a new fresh window, false otherwise
